newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary buys BB bank unit back from GE, EBRD.
newsitem.headline: Hungary buys BB bank unit back from GE, EBRD.

text.p: The Hungarian state repurchased the loss-making Polgari Bank unit of Budapest Bank (BB), which is controlled by the U.S.'s General Electric Capital Services, the finance ministry said in a statement on Monday.
GE Capital Services, which has operational control of the bank, bought a 27.4 percent stake in BB last December.
The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, which is a financial investor, has 32.4 percent, the Hungarian state 22.8 percent and other investors 17.4 percent of the bank.
GE and the EBRD bought the combined stake for $87 million.
The state bought Polgari Bank according to the guarantee, which it undertook in the privatisation contracts, for the repurchase of assets worth up to 8.25 billion forints.
The government purchased Polgari at a price equivalent to its net book value, the finance ministry said.
It did not disclose further financial details of the deal.
The statement added that the original privatisation contracts also included a guarantee from the state for the repurchase of BB shares, but this guarantee was abolished in a later agreement.
